Keeping your body in shape is essential in maintaining a healthy lifestyle. //CALORIE COUNTER Calorie Counter Calorie Counter Drag any following food items onto the plate below to find out how many calories they all add up to and how much exercise you would need to burn them all off! //HEALTH QUIZ Health Quiz Health Quiz //QUESTIONS + BUTTONS 1. D. Aerobics Check Answer 5. For the average adult, what is the healthiest heart rate to have? 

A. 60-100 bpm 
B. 40-60 bpm 
C. Above 100 bpm 
D. Below 40 bpm Check Answer //HEALTH QUIZ ANSWERS A. About one-third of US adults suffer from obesity. 
That is about 78.6 million people, and the rate is continuing to grow. D. All of those choices are health risks of obesity. 
Increased weight causes strain on a person’s arteries which causes them to suffer these illnesses and possibly die from preventable death causes. B. Tuna is the highest source of protein from the list above. 
It is also one of the highest sources of protein of any food that you can eat along with salmon and snapper, which have 22 grams in a 3 ounce filet - that is about 1 gram per 4.5 calories! C. Cycling provides the best cardio exercise to burn calories. 
If a person cycles for one hour they have the capacity to burn up to 1000 calories! A. 60-100 bpm is the average, healthy heart rate for an adult. 
Bradycardia is a slowed heart rate below 60 bpm, and Tachycardia is a fast-paced heart rate about 100 bpm.

Pulse Power "Don't go bacon my heart!" MT. JOEY Angioplasty is a procedure used to inflate narrow blood vessels for people who suffer from arterial atherosclerosis. A thin wire is placed through the narrow vessel and inflates like a balloon, widening the vessel back to normal and improving blood flow. Then the balloon is deflated and removed. How to have a healthy heart! "To keep your heart healthy, you need to eat healthy. Try to avoid excessive fatty foods like cookies and chips. These fatty foods can lead to high blood pressure and high blood sugar. Try eating more fruits and veggies. Exercise daily. It doesn't have to be 1000 push-ups. As long as you exercise for at least an hour a day, it keeps heart issues away Avoid too much cholesterol. Too much cholesterol can cause your arteries to have blockages and lead to heart problems."
BACK Plumbing Pulmonary Your heart’s plumbing system’s goal is to circulate blood with oxygen from the heart to the rest of the body. The main “roads” is arteries and veins. Arteries carry away blood from the heart and veins bring blood to the heart. First, blood comes in through the veins to the right atrium. The blood is passed on to the right ventricle. The pulmonary artery then carries the blood to the lungs so it can receive oxygen. The veins carry the blood back to the left atrium. The blood is passed on to the left ventricle. Then the aorta carries to the blood to the rest of the body.
